text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the model to outline that a claimant must show they have a right to exclusive possession of the land. The candidate answer explicitly addresses this under the heading '1. Standing (Who Can Sue?)', stating: 'You must have a proprietary interest in the land affected. Following Hunter v Canary Wharf, only those with: Freehold ownership, Leasehold interest, Exclusive possession can bring a claim.' This directly satisfies the requirement.", "criterion_id": "6d2bc9d2-cc63-40a2-8f9f-ff98e66c8578"}
